name: py-pytorch-lightning

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: extra
variants.description: Install extra dependencies for full functionality

description: PyTorch Lightning is the lightweight PyTorch wrapper for ML researchers.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-torch
dependencies.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.

dependencies.name: py-tqdm
dependencies.description: A Fast, Extensible Progress Meter

dependencies.name: py-pyyaml
dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependencies.name: py-fsspec
dependencies.description: A specification for pythonic filesystems.

dependencies.name: py-torchmetrics
dependencies.description: Machine learning metrics for distributed, scalable PyTorch applications.

dependencies.name: py-packaging
dependencies.description: Core utilities for Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependencies.name: py-lightning-utilities
dependencies.description: Common Python utilities and GitHub Actions in Lightning Ecosystem

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-omegaconf
dependencies.description:
A hierarchical configuration system, with support for merging
configurations from multiple sources (YAML config files,
dataclasses/objects and CLI arguments) providing a consistent API
regardless of how the configuration was created.

dependencies.name: py-hydra-core
dependencies.description: A framework for elegantly configuring complex applications.

dependencies.name: py-jsonargparse
dependencies.description:
An extension to python's argparse which simplifies parsing of
configuration options from command line arguments, json configuration
files (yaml or jsonnet supersets), environment variables and hard-coded
defaults.

dependencies.name: py-rich
dependencies.description:
Rich is a Python library for rich text and beautiful formatting in the
terminal.

dependencies.name: py-tensorboardx
dependencies.description:
The purpose of this package is to let researchers use a simple interface
to log events within PyTorch (and then show visualization in
tensorboard). This package currently supports logging scalar, image,
audio, histogram, text, embedding, and the route of back-propagation.

dependencies.name: py-lightning-lite
dependencies.description:
LightningLite enables pure PyTorch users to scale their existing code on
any kind of device while retaining full control over their own loops and
optimization logic.

dependencies.name: py-future
dependencies.description: Clean single-source support for Python 3 and 2

dependencies.name: pil
dependencies.description:
Pillow is a fork of the Python Imaging Library (PIL). It adds image
processing capabilities to your Python interpreter. This library
supports many file formats, and provides powerful image processing and
graphics capabilities.

dependencies.name: py-protobuf
dependencies.description:
Protocol buffers are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral,
extensible mechanism for serializing structured data - think XML, but
smaller, faster, and simpler. You define how you want your data to be
structured once, then you can use special generated source code to
easily write and read your structured data to and from a variety of data
streams and using a variety of languages.

dependencies.name: py-pydeprecate
dependencies.description:
Simple tooling for marking deprecated functions or classes and re-
routing to the new successors' instance.

dependencies.name: py-tensorboard
dependencies.description:
TensorBoard is a suite of web applications for inspecting and
understanding your TensorFlow runs and graphs.

dependencies.name: py-gcsfs
dependencies.description: Pythonic file-system for Google Cloud Storage.

dependencies.name: py-horovod
dependencies.description:
Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for
TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.

dependencies.name: py-onnx
dependencies.description:
Open Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) is an open ecosystem that empowers
AI developers to choose the right tools as their project evolves. ONNX
provides an open source format for AI models, both deep learning and
traditional ML. It defines an extensible computation graph model, as
well as definitions of built-in operators and standard data types.
Currently we focus on the capabilities needed for inferencing (scoring).

dependencies.name: py-onnxruntime
dependencies.description:
ONNX Runtime is a performance-focused complete scoring engine for Open
Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) models, with an open extensible
architecture to continually address the latest developments in AI and
Deep Learning. ONNX Runtime stays up to date with the ONNX standard with
complete implementation of all ONNX operators, and supports all ONNX
releases (1.2+) with both future and backwards compatibility.

dependencies.name: py-torchtext
dependencies.description: Text utilities and datasets for PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-fastfold
dependent_to.description:
Optimizing Protein Structure Prediction Model Training and Inference on
GPU Clusters.

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, samplers, transforms, and pre-trained models for
geospatial data. TorchGeo is a PyTorch domain library, similar to
torchvision, providing datasets, samplers, transforms, and pre-trained
models specific to geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: py-lightning
dependent_to.description:
Use Lightning Apps to build everything from production-ready, multi-
cloud ML systems to simple research demos.

dependent_to.name: py-horovod
dependent_to.description:
Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for
TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.

dependent_to.name: py-lightly
dependent_to.description: A deep learning package for self-supervised learning.
